Name: Kneeling Statue Holding Ram's Head
Description: This statue was dedicated to the temple of the god Amun; it depicts a man kneeling and holding in his hands the head of a ram, the sacred animal of Amun as well as of the god Khnum. The owner of the statue is kneeling on a rectangular base adorned with a frieze of inscription giving an offering formula. The name of the owner is not on the base. He is wearing a short royal kilt and a long wig that reaches his chest and leaves his ears exposed. The statue is well modeled; the features of the man and the ram's head are very realistic.
